controls.label: Reason for encounter
controls.description: The reason for initiation of any healthcare encounter or contact by the individual who is the subject of care.

termDefinition.description: The reason for initiation of any healthcare encounter or contact by the individual who is the subject of care.

controls.label: Description
controls.description: Description of the reason for encounter

termDefinition.description: Description of the reason for encounter

at0007.description: Type of occurrence for this symptom or sign?

at0008.description: The name of the reported symptom or sign.

at0009.description: This is the first ever occurrence of this symptom or sign.

at0010.description: This is not the first occurrence of this symptom or sign.

at0013.description: The duration of this episode of the symptom or sign since onset.
at0013.comment: If 'Date/time of onset' and 'Date/time of resolution' are used in systems, this data element may be calculated, or alternatively, be considered redundant in this scenario.

at0022.description: Category representing the overall severity of the symptom or sign.
at0022.comment: Defining values such as mild, moderate or severe in such a way that is applicable to multiple symptoms or signs plus allows multiple users to interpret and record them consistently is not easy. Some organisations extend the value set further with inclusion of additional values such as 'Trivial' and 'Very severe', and/or 'Mild-Moderate' and 'Moderate-Severe', adds to the definitional difficulty and may also worsen inter-recorder reliability issues. Use of 'Life-threatening' and 'Fatal' is also often considered as part of this value set, although from a pure point of view it may actually reflect an outcome rather than a severity. In view of the above, keeping to a well-defined but smaller list is preferred and so the mild/moderate/severe value set is offered, however the choice of other text allows for other value sets to be included at this data element in a template. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the 'Specific details' SLOT.

at0023.description: The intensity of the symptom or sign does not cause interference with normal activity.

at0024.description: The intensity of the symptom or sign causes interference with normal activity.

at0025.description: The intensity of the symptom or sign causes prevents normal activity

at0031.description: Detail about how a specific factor effects the identified symptom or sign during this episode.

at0033.comment: Examples of modifying factor: lying on multiple pillows, eating or administration of a specific medication, position,

at0038.description: Narrative description of the effect of the modifying factor on the symptom or sign.

at0039.description: Details about specified factors that are associated with the precipitation or resolution of the symptom or sign.
at0039.comment: For example: onset of headache occurred one week prior to menstruation; or onset of headache occurred one hour after fall of bicycle.

at0040.description: Name of the health event, symptom, reported sign or other factor.
at0040.comment: For example: onset of another symptom; onset of menstruation; or fall off bicycle.

at0044.description: Narrative description about the effect of the factor on the identified symptom or sign.

at0045.description: Details about specified factors that are associated with the precipitation or resolution of the symptom or sign.
at0045.comment: For example: onset of headache occurred one week prior to menstruation; or onset of headache occurred one hour after fall of bicycle.

at0046.description: Name of the health event, symptom, reported sign or other factor.

at0047.description: Narrative description about the effect of the factor on the identified symptom or sign.

at0048.description: Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.
at0048.comment: For example: a text description of the immediate onset of the symptom, activities that worsened or relieved the symptom, whether it is improving or worsening and how it resolved over weeks.

at0049.description: Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.
at0049.comment: For example: a text description of the immediate onset of the symptom, activities that worsened or relieved the symptom, whether it is improving or worsening and how it resolved over weeks.

at0055.description: Name of medication, class or type of medication.
at0055.comment: For example: Oxycodone; opioid; or analgesic.

at0056.description: Is the individual using the medication, class or type of medication at or during the identified event?

at0057.description: Narrative description about the use of the medication, class or type of medication at, or during, the identified event.

at0062.description: Risk of harmful or undesirable, physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance.
at0062.comment: For example: Rash, vomiting, Dyspepsia, pruritus, etc.

at0064.comment: For example: 'Glucose', 'Urea and Electrolytes', 'Swab', 'Cortisol (am)', 'Potassium in perspiration' or 'Melanoma histopathology'. The name may sometimes include specimen type and patient state, for example 'Fasting blood glucose' or include other information, as 'Potassium (PNA blood gas)'.

at0065.description: Narrative description of the key findings.
at0065.comment: For example: 'Pattern suggests significant renal impairment'. The content of the conclusion will vary, depending on the investigation performed.

at0067.description: Identification of the imaging examination or procedure performed, typically including modality and anatomical location (including laterality).

at0068.description: Actual date of the laboratory test result

at0069.description: Actual date of the imaging test result

at0070.description: Narrative description of the key findings.

at0071.description: The reason for initiation of any healthcare encounter or contact by the individual who is the subject of care.

at0073.description: Doubts about any topic; not involving an especific interrogatory or a proper consult

at0074.description: Any doubt realated to medication: dosis, prescription, route, interactions, etc

at0075.description: Doubts related to Sexual Health, Birth control - Contraception, STD's, Pregnancy, etc

at0076.description: A brie interpretation of a routine test result

at0077.description: An advice related to medicine of an specific topic

at0078.description: Questions about everything related to the app; tecnical issues, etc

at0079.description: A proper Medical Consult; involving SOAP

at0081.description: Description of the reason for encounter

at0083.description: The reason for initiation of any healthcare encounter or contact by the individual who is the subject of care.

controls.label: Symptom
controls.description: The name of the reported symptom or sign.

termDefinition.description: The name of the reported symptom or sign.

controls.label: Ocurrence
controls.description: Type of occurrence for this symptom or sign?

termDefinition.description: Type of occurrence for this symptom or sign?

controls.label: Duration

termDefinition.description: The duration of this episode of the symptom or sign since onset.
termDefinition.comment: If 'Date/time of onset' and 'Date/time of resolution' are used in systems, this data element may be calculated, or alternatively, be considered redundant in this scenario.

controls.label: Severity
controls.description: Category representing the overall severity of the symptom or sign.

termDefinition.description: Category representing the overall severity of the symptom or sign.
termDefinition.comment: Defining values such as mild, moderate or severe in such a way that is applicable to multiple symptoms or signs plus allows multiple users to interpret and record them consistently is not easy. Some organisations extend the value set further with inclusion of additional values such as 'Trivial' and 'Very severe', and/or 'Mild-Moderate' and 'Moderate-Severe', adds to the definitional difficulty and may also worsen inter-recorder reliability issues. Use of 'Life-threatening' and 'Fatal' is also often considered as part of this value set, although from a pure point of view it may actually reflect an outcome rather than a severity. In view of the above, keeping to a well-defined but smaller list is preferred and so the mild/moderate/severe value set is offered, however the choice of other text allows for other value sets to be included at this data element in a template. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the 'Specific details' SLOT.

controls.label: Description of Previous Episodes

termDefinition.description: Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.
termDefinition.comment: For example: a text description of the immediate onset of the symptom, activities that worsened or relieved the symptom, whether it is improving or worsening and how it resolved over weeks.

controls.label: Episode Description
controls.description: Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.

termDefinition.description: Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.
termDefinition.comment: For example: a text description of the immediate onset of the symptom, activities that worsened or relieved the symptom, whether it is improving or worsening and how it resolved over weeks.

Some organisations extend the value set further with inclusion of additional values such as 'Trivial' and 'Very severe', and/or 'Mild-Moderate' and 'Moderate-Severe', adds to the definitional difficulty and may also worsen inter-recorder reliability issues. at0007.description: Type of occurrence for this symptom or sign?

at0008.description: The name of the reported symptom or sign.

at0009.description: This is the first ever occurrence of this symptom or sign.

at0010.description: This is not the first occurrence of this symptom or sign.

at0013.description: The duration of this episode of the symptom or sign since onset.
at0013.comment: If 'Date/time of onset' and 'Date/time of resolution' are used in systems, this data element may be calculated, or alternatively, be considered redundant in this scenario.

at0022.description: Category representing the overall severity of the symptom or sign.
at0022.comment: Defining values such as mild, moderate or severe in such a way that is applicable to multiple symptoms or signs plus allows multiple users to interpret and record them consistently is not easy. Some organisations extend the value set further with inclusion of additional values such as 'Trivial' and 'Very severe', and/or 'Mild-Moderate' and 'Moderate-Severe', adds to the definitional difficulty and may also worsen inter-recorder reliability issues. Use of 'Life-threatening' and 'Fatal' is also often considered as part of this value set, although from a pure point of view it may actually reflect an outcome rather than a severity. In view of the above, keeping to a well-defined but smaller list is preferred and so the mild/moderate/severe value set is offered, however the choice of other text allows for other value sets to be included at this data element in a template. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the 'Specific details' SLOT.

at0023.description: The intensity of the symptom or sign does not cause interference with normal activity.

at0024.description: The intensity of the symptom or sign causes interference with normal activity.

at0025.description: The intensity of the symptom or sign causes prevents normal activity

at0031.description: Detail about how a specific factor effects the identified symptom or sign during this episode.

at0033.comment: Examples of modifying factor: lying on multiple pillows, eating or administration of a specific medication, position,

at0038.description: Narrative description of the effect of the modifying factor on the symptom or sign.

at0039.description: Details about specified factors that are associated with the precipitation or resolution of the symptom or sign.
at0039.comment: For example: onset of headache occurred one week prior to menstruation; or onset of headache occurred one hour after fall of bicycle.

at0040.description: Name of the health event, symptom, reported sign or other factor.
at0040.comment: For example: onset of another symptom; onset of menstruation; or fall off bicycle.

at0044.description: Narrative description about the effect of the factor on the identified symptom or sign.

at0045.description: Details about specified factors that are associated with the precipitation or resolution of the symptom or sign.
at0045.comment: For example: onset of headache occurred one week prior to menstruation; or onset of headache occurred one hour after fall of bicycle.

at0046.description: Name of the health event, symptom, reported sign or other factor.

at0047.description: Narrative description about the effect of the factor on the identified symptom or sign.

at0048.description: Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.
at0048.comment: For example: a text description of the immediate onset of the symptom, activities that worsened or relieved the symptom, whether it is improving or worsening and how it resolved over weeks.

at0049.description: Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.
at0049.comment: For example: a text description of the immediate onset of the symptom, activities that worsened or relieved the symptom, whether it is improving or worsening and how it resolved over weeks.

at0055.description: Name of medication, class or type of medication.
at0055.comment: For example: Oxycodone; opioid; or analgesic.

at0056.description: Is the individual using the medication, class or type of medication at or during the identified event?

at0057.description: Narrative description about the use of the medication, class or type of medication at, or during, the identified event.

at0062.description: Risk of harmful or undesirable, physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance.
at0062.comment: For example: Rash, vomiting, Dyspepsia, pruritus, etc.

at0064.comment: For example: 'Glucose', 'Urea and Electrolytes', 'Swab', 'Cortisol (am)', 'Potassium in perspiration' or 'Melanoma histopathology'. The name may sometimes include specimen type and patient state, for example 'Fasting blood glucose' or include other information, as 'Potassium (PNA blood gas)'.

at0065.description: Narrative description of the key findings.
at0065.comment: For example: 'Pattern suggests significant renal impairment'. The content of the conclusion will vary, depending on the investigation performed.

at0009.description: This is the first ever occurrence of this symptom or sign.

at0010.description: This is not the first occurrence of this symptom or sign.

at0013.description: The duration of this episode of the symptom or sign since onset.
at0013.comment: If 'Date/time of onset' and 'Date/time of resolution' are used in systems, this data element may be calculated, or alternatively, be considered redundant in this scenario.

at0022.description: Category representing the overall severity of the symptom or sign.
at0022.comment: Defining values such as mild, moderate or severe in such a way that is applicable to multiple symptoms or signs plus allows multiple users to interpret and record them consistently is not easy. Some organisations extend the value set further with inclusion of additional values such as 'Trivial' and 'Very severe', and/or 'Mild-Moderate' and 'Moderate-Severe', adds to the definitional difficulty and may also worsen inter-recorder reliability issues. Use of 'Life-threatening' and 'Fatal' is also often considered as part of this value set, although from a pure point of view it may actually reflect an outcome rather than a severity. In view of the above, keeping to a well-defined but smaller list is preferred and so the mild/moderate/severe value set is offered, however the choice of other text allows for other value sets to be included at this data element in a template. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the 'Specific details' SLOT.

at0023.description: The intensity of the symptom or sign does not cause interference with normal activity.

at0024.description: The intensity of the symptom or sign causes interference with normal activity.

at0025.description: The intensity of the symptom or sign causes prevents normal activity

at0031.description: Detail about how a specific factor effects the identified symptom or sign during this episode.

at0033.comment: Examples of modifying factor: lying on multiple pillows, eating or administration of a specific medication, position,

at0038.description: Narrative description of the effect of the modifying factor on the symptom or sign.

at0039.description: Details about specified factors that are associated with the precipitation or resolution of the symptom or sign.
at0039.comment: For example: onset of headache occurred one week prior to menstruation; or onset of headache occurred one hour after fall of bicycle.

at0040.description: Name of the health event, symptom, reported sign or other factor.
at0040.comment: For example: onset of another symptom; onset of menstruation; or fall off bicycle.

at0044.description: Narrative description about the effect of the factor on the identified symptom or sign.

at0045.description: Details about specified factors that are associated with the precipitation or resolution of the symptom or sign.
at0045.comment: For example: onset of headache occurred one week prior to menstruation; or onset of headache occurred one hour after fall of bicycle.

at0046.description: Name of the health event, symptom, reported sign or other factor.

at0047.description: Narrative description about the effect of the factor on the identified symptom or sign.

at0048.description: Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.
at0048.comment: For example: a text description of the immediate onset of the symptom, activities that worsened or relieved the symptom, whether it is improving or worsening and how it resolved over weeks.

at0049.description: Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.
at0049.comment: For example: a text description of the immediate onset of the symptom, activities that worsened or relieved the symptom, whether it is improving or worsening and how it resolved over weeks.

at0055.description: Name of medication, class or type of medication.
at0055.comment: For example: Oxycodone; opioid; or analgesic.

at0056.description: Is the individual using the medication, class or type of medication at or during the identified event?

at0057.description: Narrative description about the use of the medication, class or type of medication at, or during, the identified event.

at0062.description: Risk of harmful or undesirable, physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance.
at0062.comment: For example: Rash, vomiting, Dyspepsia, pruritus, etc.

at0064.comment: For example: 'Glucose', 'Urea and Electrolytes', 'Swab', 'Cortisol (am)', 'Potassium in perspiration' or 'Melanoma histopathology'. The name may sometimes include specimen type and patient state, for example 'Fasting blood glucose' or include other information, as 'Potassium (PNA blood gas)'.

at0065.description: Narrative description of the key findings.
at0065.comment: For example: 'Pattern suggests significant renal impairment'. The content of the conclusion will vary, depending on the investigation performed.

at0067.description: Identification of the imaging examination or procedure performed, typically including modality and anatomical location (including laterality).

at0068.description: Actual date of the laboratory test result

at0069.description: Actual date of the imaging test result

at0070.description: Narrative description of the key findings.

at0071.description: The reason for initiation of any healthcare encounter or contact by the individual who is the subject of care.

at0073.description: Doubts about any topic; not involving an especific interrogatory or a proper consult

at0074.description: Any doubt realated to medication: dosis, prescription, route, interactions, etc

at0075.description: Doubts related to Sexual Health, Birth control - Contraception, STD's, Pregnancy, etc

at0076.description: A brie interpretation of a routine test result

at0077.description: An advice related to medicine of an specific topic

at0078.description: Questions about everything related to the app; tecnical issues, etc

at0079.description: A proper Medical Consult; involving SOAP

at0081.description: Description of the reason for encounter

at0083.description: The reason for initiation of any healthcare encounter or contact by the individual who is the subject of care.
